title: Machine Learning for Absolute Beginners - Data Visualization with Python
headline: Learn data visualization and analysis using Matplotlib and Seaborn Python libraries in this free online course.
description: This online training course introduces the fundamental concepts and required syntax for creating data visualization diagrams and charts in Python. We will learn how to leverage Matplotlib and Seaborn Python libraries to create various charts, including bar, pie, heat-maps, histograms and many more. We will also discuss how to select the most relevant chart for the needed task and smartly adjust the parameters of each chart.
courseDescription:
Data science is gaining momentum in various applications, becoming one of the most exciting fields used in high-tech industries. It is an interdisciplinary field that uses scientific methods, algorithms and visualization methods to extract knowledge and insights from data. As a result, a growing number of companies are looking for data scientists, data engineers and machine learning experts to develop products, features and projects that will help them unleash the power of data in practical data science projects.

Sometimes a picture is worth a thousand words or one might say ‘a chart is worth a thousand data points’. When handling and processing data, the first and most important step is to know your data in detail. Therefore, it is essential to apply an Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) method across the available datasets by summarising their main characteristics using statistical and data visualization methods. Using this approach, we will be able to understand the features in the dataset. Check the fill-rate of relevant features for testing data quality, and understand each feature's scale and unit to decide if any normalisation or transformation actions will be needed. We will also test how they are correlated to each other to better select the most relevant features and identify data patterns that will be useful for the subsequent steps.

In Python, there are a variety of data science libraries being used for performing data visualization. This training will focus on two prevalent libraries called ‘Matplotlib’ and ‘Seaborn’. Using those libraries, we will be able to create various visualization charts, including bar charts, pie charts, tree-map charts, line and area charts, histograms, density curve charts and many more. We will learn to select the most relevant chart for the needed job and adjust each chart's parameters to get a pixel-perfect result for our project's needs. Enrol today and start your journey to become a data scientist!
